Package fr.ens.biologie.generic.utils

Class Interval

java.lang.Object
fr.ens.biologie.generic.utils.Interval
public class Interval extends Object
A (simple) class for mathematical intervals. Handles closed, open, half-open and half-closed intervals; and infinite values.

Immutable. Comes with method to compare interval, check overlap, etc.

The constructor for this class is private. To get an instance, use the static methods provided here.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 12 juin 2019

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(double x)
      Test if the interval contains a value. Does not use double equality in order to give a reliable result.
      Parameters:
      x - the number to check
      Returns:
      true if x is contained in this interval

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • valueOf

      public static Interval valueOf​(String interval)
      Construct an interval from a String representation produced with toString().

      Valid Strings for input are:

      • [x,y], [x,y[, ]x,y] or ]x,y[, where x and y are double numbers
      • ]-Inf,y], ]-Inf,y[, ]-∞,y] or ]-∞,y] where y is a double number
      • [x,+Inf[, ]x,+Inf[, [x,+∞[ or ]x,+∞[ where x is a double number
      • ]-Inf,+Inf[, ]-Inf,+∞[, ]-∞,+Inf[ or ]-∞,+∞[

      Any other String will raise an Exception. Do not forget to trim blank space before calling this method.

      Parameters:
      interval - a String representing an interval
      Returns:
      an interval instance

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object o)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • overlaps

      public boolean overlaps​(Interval i)
      Parameters:
      i - The other Interval
      Returns:
      true if the two intervals overlap

    • contiguousTo

      public boolean contiguousTo​(Interval i)
      Test if two intervals are exactly contiguous to each other, eg [0,2[ and [2,3], [0,2] and ]2,3] will return true, but [0,2[ and ]2,3], [0,2] and [2,3], will return false.
      Parameters:
      i - the interval to compare with this instance
      Returns:
      true if both intervals are contiguous

    • union

      public Interval union​(Interval i)
      Compute the union of two overlapping intervals (null if non overlapping).
      Parameters:
      i - The other interval.
      Returns:
      The union if the overlap of the two intervals (null if non-overlapping).

      public Interval intersection​(Interval i)
      Parameters:
      i - The other interval
      Returns:
      the intersection of two intervals (null if non-overlapping)
